WorkItem.Description:
Newly installed 2.1.5.  When updating the wowhead item cache I received an error "Input string was not in a correct format"
 
This is the item it appears to have had problems with:
 
  <Item>
    <Name>Idol of the Raven Goddess</Name>
    <Id>32387</Id>
    <ItemLevel>0</ItemLevel>
    <IconPath>inv-mount_raven_54</IconPath>
    <Slot>Ranged</Slot>
    <Stats>
      <CritRating>20</CritRating>
      <IdolCritRating>20</IdolCritRating>
      <TreeOfLifeAura>44</TreeOfLifeAura>
    </Stats>
    <Sockets>
      <Stats />
    </Sockets>
    <Quality>Rare</Quality>
    <Type>Idol</Type>
    <Unique>true</Unique>
  </Item>
WorkItem.Summary: Input string was not in a correct format when updating wowhead cache

Comments.Message:
Reoccurred in 2.1.6 for the following item:

Input string was not in a correct format

  <Item>
    <Name>Thori'dal, the Stars' Fury</Name>
    <Id>34334</Id>
    <ItemLevel>164</ItemLevel>
    <IconPath>inv_weapon_bow_39</IconPath>
    <Slot>Ranged</Slot>
    <Stats>
      <Agility>17</Agility>
      <AttackPower>34</AttackPower>
      <ArmorPenetrationRating>17</ArmorPenetrationRating>
      <CritRating>16</CritRating>
    </Stats>
    <Sockets>
      <Stats />
    </Sockets>
    <Quality>Legendary</Quality>
    <Type>Bow</Type>
    <MinDamage>355</MinDamage>
    <MaxDamage>524</MaxDamage>
    <Speed>2.7</Speed>
    <Unique>true</Unique>
  </Item>

Perhaps you could add code to skip the offending item and continue the scan but report them at the end?  When these type of errors occur it is killing the scanning process so you basically have to start all over.  Granted shouldn't have to do them often, but when the process takes 10-15 mins starting over is kind of annoying.
